question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, expert responses. Ensure that the code you provide is executable for demonstration. Create an interactive periodic table where clicking on elements displays a detailed information popup, with support for filtering and arranging by group/period/state.

checklist.title: Is the interactive periodic table structure properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code correctly implements the periodic table layout with accurate positioning of all 118 elements according to their groups and periods. Check if elements are visually distinct with appropriate atomic number, symbol, name, and basic properties visible at a glance. Score 0 if the periodic table structure is incorrect or incomplete, 5 if the basic layout is present but has positioning errors, and 10 if the periodic table accurately represents the standard IUPAC periodic table layout.

checklist.title: Is the element information popup functionality complete?
checklist.description: Verify that clicking on elements triggers a detailed information popup showing comprehensive element data (atomic number, mass, electron configuration, discovery year, physical properties, etc.). The popup should be well-designed with proper closing mechanism. Deduct 3 points if key properties are missing, 3 points if the popup has positioning/display issues, and 2 points if transitions are jarring or non-existent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the filtering and arrangement capabilities implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code includes UI controls to filter elements by properties (e.g., metals/non-metals, state at room temperature) and to arrange the table by different criteria (group/period/state). The filtering should be responsive and visually indicate which elements match the criteria. Deduct 4 points if only basic filtering is implemented without arrangement options, 3 points if transitions between views are not smooth, and 3 points if multiple filter combinations are not supported. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the visual representation of element states and properties implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code uses appropriate color coding or visual indicators to represent different element categories (metals, non-metals, metalloids) and states (solid, liquid, gas at standard conditions). There should be a legend explaining the visual coding system. Deduct 3 points if color coding is inconsistent with scientific conventions, 3 points if the legend is missing, and 4 points if visual distinctions between element categories are unclear. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as browser resizing, touch vs. mouse input, missing element data, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Element comparison functionality 2. Interactive electron configuration visualizations 3. Historical timeline of element discovery 4. Integration with external chemical databases). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functionality (e.g., multiple filtering mechanisms) 2. Function modules unrelated to periodic table visualization (e.g., unnecessary animations) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive 3D rendering). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data/view/controller layers), code organization, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the element data is hardcoded rather than loaded from a structured data source. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (scientific accuracy balanced with visual appeal) 2) Proper layout spacing (element cells properly sized with adequate spacing) 3) Professional typography (clear hierarchical text with proper contrast). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Immediate visual feedback on hover/selection 2) Smooth transitions when filtering or rearranging elements 3) Intuitive UI controls with clear affordances. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for choppy animations during filtering, and 5 points for unintuitive interaction patterns. The full score is 10 points.
